definition: to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: My foreign-currency card has an 8-digit password. Is it accepted by your ATM?
sentences.chinese: 我所持的外卡有8位密码，能否在你行ATM交易？

sentences.english: The wild-card player surprised everyone by winning the championship.
sentences.chinese: 那位外卡选手跌破众人的眼镜，赢得了冠军。

sentences.english: Accept the card sponsors, she participated in the Nationwide Tour.
sentences.chinese: 接受赞助商外卡，她参加了纳信怀德巡回赛。

sentences.english: Consumer prices could be a wild card for 2011.
sentences.chinese: 2011年消费价格可能是一个外卡。

sentences.english: Mahan has played on the last three American Ryder Cup teams, always as a captain's pick.
sentences.chinese: 马汉一直凭借着队长的外卡打过三届美国莱德杯。

sentences.english: When Does the Wild Card Change in Follow the Queen Poker Game?
sentences.chinese: 什么时候后续女王扑克游戏外卡变化？。

definition: Wimbledon Championships (tennis)/abbr. for 溫布爾登網球公開賽|温布尔登网球公开赛[Wen1 bu4 er3 deng1 Wang3 qiu2 Gong1 kai1 sai4]
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
to compete/to take part in a competition
